subject: Cybersecurity
title: WarGames: The Movie That Scared a President
description: A micro-lesson that makes WarGames: The Movie That Scared a President usable.

hook.text: In 1983, a Hollywood movie about a teen hacker nearly starting WWIII changed real U.S. law.

buildup.text: WarGames showed a kid dialing into a military computer. President Reagan watched it and asked: could this happen?

discovery.text: His advisors said yes. The result was the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act of 1986.

twist.text: A fictional movie created the legal framework that still prosecutes hackers decades later.

climax.text: Fiction shaped reality. Hollywood's imagination became the government's nightmare.

punchline.text: A movie scared a president into inventing cybercrime law.

quiz.question: What law was partly inspired by the 1983 movie WarGames?
options: The Computer Fraud and Abuse Act
